pros: You know your coworkers and feel a part of a team. You are not just a number. Competitive Pay and Benefits.
cons: Don't have any cons to share

pros: -great incentives for picking overtime -great benefits, 403b has a good match -tuition reimbursement -welcoming environment -sympathetic floor manager, nice, kind, understanding and will help you -some nurses are great and some are lazy but that goes for every hospital
cons: -low retention rate, nurses only stay for a short period of time. -they heavily concentrate on recruitment and not on the loyal employees that have stayed with them for a long time -no raises per year -the PTO system is rigged, not good at how they've been managing it -no holiday pay -no growth for staffs

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Oswego, NY
pros: Benefits, plenty of OT available
cons: Stressful, sometimes feels like management out of touch with staff, unrealistic expectations

review_title: Understaffed, but overall good organization with strong community support
pros: Oswego Health has been a staple in the Oswego County community and they very much care about providing the best services they can do their community.
cons: Understaffed. As folks leave the organization, work is delegated to other employees instead of hiring new. This leads to burnout.

pros: Small hospital and nice new Lab. Equipment is also fairly recent.
cons: Doesn’t pay well and keep changing their mind (HR) on benefits!!

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Oswego, NY
pros: Great colleges to work with
cons: Hours can be long at times

pros:
Tuition Reimbursement
403B Plan
EAP benefits
Free coffee & drinks provided
cons:
Very little covid-19 precautions
Negligent Supervisor
Racist coworkers
Poor work-life balance 
To stay caught up I had to do work at home for hours, and then would rarely get paid for all of my overtime
Had to take on other people's work because they were so far behind
Horrible co-workers
No lactation area (at the mental health center)
Unclean work environment
Non-supportive admin

pros: Benefits, days off, consistency in work
cons: Low pay, coworkers are touch and go, low staffed

pros: Good pay scale and nice place to work
cons: not enough raises...need more incentive bonuses

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in New York, NY
pros: The staff is great. 90% work together and understand team work.
cons:
Ungodly patient load. Management is reactive, not pro-active. You are expected to do more with less, working conditions are unsafe at best.

CEO makes 1/2 million a year while they removed incentives (no contributions to your 403B!). Worked there 14 years, always got glowing yearly evaluations and never received a raise based on my performance once.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Oswego, NY
pros: No pros to this conpany
cons: Management do not work with employees.

pros: Good IT dept. not many good things to report on here. I am glad it’s over
cons: Corporate staff have little connection. Didn’t have a great experience. I am glad I don’t work here anymore.

review_title: Great medical and nursing staff, do not care about nurses
pros: Great patient care, reasonable benefits, self scheduling
cons: Nurse's ideas and concerns are not considered when decisions are being made. If there is a budget concern, decreasing nursing staff (sometimes to unsafe levels) is the answer to their problems.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN), Long-Term Care in Oswego, NY
pros: Best staffing in area, good policies in place five star rating
cons: Too top heavy in management

job_title: Quality Administrative Coordinator in Oswego, NY
pros: Growth-Driven leadership style influenced me to be more productive
cons: Long hours prevented me from feeling motivated at times.

pros: Night crews are the best on med surg. They help you care for the patients instead of throwing orders at you. The pay is not bad, although it could be more but the parking is free so that’s a plus
cons: Low pay, a little disorganized management. Favoritism.

job_title: Therapy Aide in Port Chester, NY
pros: Meaningful work, valuable experience, enjoyed running therapy groups, flexible scheduling.
cons: Can be stressful at times, but very manageable.

pros: There is a group of nurses that stay around forever and I consider them Friends.  It serves a small community and has some very competent Nurses that love their job and provided exceptional care.  Unfortunately they have no voice in this facility.
cons: Extreme bullying is allowed.  You are told you must take lunch but there is no one to cover.   They just take lunch break from you and steal shift differential at times.  Management is horrible.   Concerns are brought to their attention and you are not even granted the courtesy of a response.  Nurses have been allowed to behave in a condescending and rude way ; you are basically oriented in to this culture;  and when issue is brought to management nothing gets done.  I always thought that SUNY Upstate was the absolute worse for this lateral work place violence but NO Oswego Hospital takes the award!!!   Pay is very inconsistent.  They essential follow their own rules!   You realize this when you apply somewhere else and are offered $5 to $6 more per hour 😡

review_title: Full time off site from main hospital. Office staff/support 5 yrs +
pros: Mostly positive, many changes in management in the past 2 yrs. Benefits decent and attitude at main hospital has improved as far as community services and perception.
cons: Off site locations: Many positions are part-time which does not foster teamwork as position is seen as temporary stepping stone.  Lack of training time for new hires leads to inconsistent work. Little direction or correction is given to these “temps” which is frustrating to those longer term full-timers. They are left to pick up the slack and repeatedly fix errors that would affect $ / productivity.

pros:
Working in the healthcare environment gives you a sense of purpose that your doing something great for the community.

There are some awesome individuals working here, most of the staff is friendly.
cons:
Upper management only cares about numbers and revenue and not practical solutions.

Employees are treated like cattle

Communication & expectations between departments is horrible

Doctors and surgeons regularly disrespect the nursing staff.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Oswego, NY
pros: most of the regular staff are very nice.... some higher up treat you as if you are beneath them (nurses, doctors)
cons: high turn over a lot of being hired from inside first before outside which isn't always good for the company as there is a lot of drama that goes with that

review_title: Wow! Amazing place to work and an amazing culture!
pros: Amazing group of employees at all levels. New hires are made to feel very welcome. The surrounding community is just as warm and welcoming. They offer very competitive salaries, amazing benefits and a great work life balance. I couldn’t be happier with my decision to join the organization.
cons: I haven’t found any. It’s been all good.

pros: Oswego Health is a great place to work and it's close to home.  Oswego Health has revamped the compensation structure and doubled the retirement match recently.  You can trust management, the new CEO is very personable.  The staff is like family and I refer all of my family and friends to work here!
cons: The harsh winter weather !!

review_title: Sloppy operation. IT nightmare, hierarchical punitive behavior.
job_title: Psychiatric Social Worker in Fulton, NY
pros: Direct management was thoughtful and evaluative, but no one stays, high turnaround.
cons: IT systems are a mess, whole system goes down regularly. HR directors have a pattern of systemic disrespect and punitive reactions, it's best not to reach out or utilize them.

job_title: Executive Director Technician in Oswego, NY
pros: A good place to learn, some employees are helpful
cons: Lower wages, catty staff, management issues

review_title: Cannot recommend.  Serious internal issues which impact care.
pros: Excellent staff, hardworking, helpful, dedicated.
cons: Administrative ineptness, many internal problems which negatively effect patient care.

pros: Good people to work with. Unfortunately they are not treated correctly, nor are they appreciated for the good work that they do.
cons: MESSED UP well beyond repair!

review_title: Poor management administration is a joke
pros: No one else will hire you, so they will
cons: Can not keep enough staff. WHY???

pros: None and no room for advancement. Hard to satisfy.
cons: All downsides working here.
